result.execSummary:
All charges against Cody J Heinz in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody J Heinz is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State, by zoom. Defendant appeared by zoom w/ Attorney C Rose, by zoom. Clerk/H. Barnett. Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing is being held via video conferencing. Criminal charge in file 15CM1171 is dismissed on State motion. Co. Ordinance citation P429916 for possession of marijuana filed. Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court. Court imposes $263.50 total fine/costs, bond applied, any remainder of bond to be returned to the poster.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Final pre-trial on March 3, 2021 at 08:30 am. Any person entering a courtroom is required to wear a mask.
